hypothesis_content.title: ETF Flow Surprise Amplification
hypothesis_content.statement: When daily US Bitcoin ETF net flows exceed the 20-day rolling average by >2 standard deviations, the subsequent 3-day price move in the direction of the flows is amplified, with momentum continuing as the surprise triggers re-rating of medium-term flow expectations.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extreme ETF flow surprises cause market participants to update their expectations of future institutional demand/supply. This re-rating is not instantaneous; it triggers follow-on buying/selling from trend-followers, options dealers hedging new positions, and macro funds adjusting crypto allocations. The amplification is a function of the 'surprise' magnitude.
entry_conditions: US Bitcoin ETF net flow (aggregate) is published and exceeds 20-day rolling average by >2 std dev
Flow is > $300M net inflow or < -$150M net outflow
BTC price has not already moved > 3% in the direction of the flow on the day of publication
BTC is trading above its 200-day SMA (for inflows) or below (for outflows) - trend alignment
Regime is NEUTRAL or BULL (for inflows); NEUTRAL or BEAR (for outflows)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 3-day cumulative move reaches 2.5% per $500M of surprise flow (e.g., +$600M surprise inflow -> TP at +3% from entry)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reverses to the level at flow publication
exit_conditions.time_exit: 3 trading days (72 hours) after flow publication

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: No statistically significant positive correlation (p < 0.1) between standardized flow surprise magnitude and subsequent 3-day returns in the flow direction over 20+ events.
